channel.title: math.QA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.QA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Braid group action and quasi-split affine $\imath$quantum groups II: higher rank
item.description: arXiv:2311.10299v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This paper studies quantum symmetric pairs $(\widetilde{\mathbf U}, \widetilde{{\mathbf U}}^\imath )$ associated with quasi-split Satake diagrams of affine type $A_{2r-1}, D_r, E_{6}$ with a nontrivial diagram involution fixing the affine simple node. Various real and imaginary root vectors for the universal $\imath$quantum groups $\widetilde{{\mathbf U}}^\imath$ are constructed with the help of the relative braid group action, and they are used to construct affine rank one subalgebras of $\widetilde{{\mathbf U}}^\imath$. We then establish relations among real and imaginary root vectors in different affine rank one subalgebras and use them to give a Drinfeld type presentation of $\widetilde{{\mathbf U}}^\imath$.
item.dc:creator: Ming Lu, Weiqiang Wang, Weinan Zhang

item.title: A survey on set-theoretical solutions to the pentagon equation
item.description: arXiv:2312.16958v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This survey aims to collect the main results of the theory of the set-theoretical solutions to the pentagon equation obtained up to now in the literature. In particular, we present some classes of these solutions and raise some questions.
item.dc:creator: Marzia Mazzotta

item.title: Notes on a homomorphism from the affine Yangian associated with $\widehat{\mathfrak{sl}}(n)$ to the affine Yangian associated with $\widehat{\mathfrak{sl}}(n+1)$
item.description: arXiv:2402.01870v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In the previous paper, we constructed a homomorphism from the affine Yangian associated with $\widehat{\mathfrak{sl}}(n)$ to the standard degreewise completion of the affine Yangian associated with $\widehat{\mathfrak{sl}}(n+1)$. By using this homomorphism, we construct a homomorphism from the affine Yangian to the universal enveloping algebra of a non-rectangular $W$-algebra, which is different from the one in \cite{U7}. We also show that this homomorphism is related to the one from the quantum affine algebra associated with $\widehat{\mathfrak{sl}}(n)$ to the quantum affine algebra associated with $\widehat{\mathfrak{sl}}(n+1)$ given by Li.
item.dc:creator: Mamoru Ueda
